name: Data-Anonymizer
description: Uses a variety of tools and techniques for anonymizing and testing datasets of personal attributes.

skills.name: assess-identifiability
skills.description: Evaluates whether a dataset or attribute can reasonably identify the data subject under contextual and linkage risks.
examples: Evaluate re-identification risk for this dataset

skills.name: apply-deidentification-techniques
skills.description: Recommends appropriate transformations such as masking, generalization, suppression, perturbation, bucketing, hashing, or tokenization.

skills.name: compute-k-anonymity
skills.description: Computes k-anonymity, l-diversity, t-closeness, and related privacy metrics.

skills.name: recommend-safe-release
skills.description: Determines whether a dataset is safe for release under CPRA, NIST, HIPAA, and A2A norms, and provides required mitigations.
examples: Can this dataset be shared with Vendor X
What mitigations are required before release

skills.name: generate-deidentification-report
skills.description: Produces a structured, regulator-friendly report summarizing techniques applied, residual risk, and compliance posture.
examples: Create a de-identification summary for this dataset

skills.name: evaluate-auxiliary-data-risk
skills.description: Assesses how external datasets could re-identify the subject through linkage or inference.
examples: Could this be re-identified using voter rolls

skills.name: minimize-data-for-purpose
skills.description: Determines the minimum necessary personal data required for a stated purpose and flags unnecessary fields.
examples: What fields are required for account creation

skills.name: simulate-reidentification-attack
skills.description: Runs a simulated adversarial linkage attempt to estimate re-identification probability.

skills.name: map-to-deidentification-standard
skills.description: Maps the organization's proposed de-identification approach to NIST, CPRA, HIPAA Safe Harbor, and A2A requirements.
examples: Does this meet CPRA de-identification criteria

skills.name: publish-deidentification-guidance
skills.description: Generates human-readable instructions explaining how to properly de-identify the user's data for a given purpose.
examples: Explain how to de-identify my address for analytics
Provide safe handling instructions for my profile data
